Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful customer service"”
Reviews.Author: Dale J
Reviews.Content: Customer servive was wonderful, helpful and very accommodating .Teresa was very helpful as well as the front desk. I Was in Memphis for buiness and didn't want to spend much money since I would be staying for almost two weeks. They have Great prices. Rooms clean and quite.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service to Die For”
Reviews.Author: awag7
Reviews.Content: Was in Memphis for Business, and had to go to Nashville, ask Teresa Filinger for helping to find a hotel in southern Nashville. She got me in at a Red Roof with a Great Rate. Teresa's not the only one there who looks after the Guest, Allyn, Phills, Masiline, Willi Mae, Mariea, and all the staff there are so great. Granted this location is not the Best Looking in the Memphis area like the Peabody, but their Customer Service and Friendly manner makes you feel like your at the Peabody.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelMemphis
Reviews.Content: Great stay, price. Thanks to Teresa Fillinger for going beyond the call of duty to make my stay great. Great check in by Crystal Webb. Thanks for a job well done guys. Jimmy Mercer

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: wendydrake2005
Reviews.Content: Two weeks before Christmas I experience being rob and did not have any money to pay for hotel accommodation: I immediately call the Red Roof Inn Memphis East and spoke to the front desk clerk (Della) who advise me that the manager Chris will call me back: Chris called me back immediately to offer me accommodation there at Red Roof until the next day when I could have money wired to me. He also offered me his own personal money to get me something to eat. Now If this is not service then I don't know what is. I could not write this review without including the from desk hostess Theresa Filinnger she is awesome: she always have a great smile, call guest by their name, and most of all she is the one who keep guest coming back to the Red Roof Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive choice to spend the night, not much else.”
Reviews.Author: mtsublueraider
Reviews.Content: Don't get it confused, I'm not going to vacation here. It was, however, a decent place to stay for one night. I checked in late and the staff at the front desk (who had to buzz me in) had my information and reservation ready to go. Grabbed the key and crossed the parking lot to my room. King bed, standard items, but plenty of room. It was very old but clean for the most part. The AC/Heat was either REAL hot or REAL cold. No middle ground there. I actually had to walk back to the front desk for shampoo and soap only to discover that they wrap it up in the bath mat on the tub. Wonder if anyone else has done the same thing? Didn't realize that at the time. It's good that you can walk to the Cracker Barrel which is right next door and parking is free with plenty of room. I'd ask for a room on the back side of the building near cracker barrel because the noise continues through the night from the main parking lot. Served the purpose for sure and that's all I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: 7dorks
Reviews.Content: I spent the better part of the past 2 weeks in this hotel and it was great. The room was very clean, the staff was VERY friendly and the price was the best value in the area ! I could not have been happier with my stay at the Memphis East Red Roof ! Kudos to the entire staff ! Thank You !

Reviews.Title: “Great for a traveller overnight.”
Reviews.Author: kate h
Reviews.Content: First of all, the front desk clerk Krystal was extremely helpful. I called while looking for the hotel and she was very helpful. When I got there she was great as well. The room was nothing fancy but was definitely acceptable. The only problem was the noise due to the proximity to a busy road. Be mindful of which side you stay on if you are easily awoken.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Steve W
Reviews.Content: Spent a thrusday night here. The staff were very helpful. The front desk clerk Crystal was extremely helpful ensuring we had a good stay. The internet service was being worked on when we arrive and when it was repaired she called the room to advise. The 1st. room we were in the TV did not work so Crystal moved us to another room. It is not a new motel but it was clean and the staff make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay and will return”
Reviews.Author: JOHNBOY450
Reviews.Content: the day mgr teresa fillinger was very nice and very helpful to me while i was in Memphis. Just wanted to acknowledge her. JOHN THOMPSON LOUISVILLE KY. JTBRACES@AOL.COM

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the Rate!”
Reviews.Author: awag7
Reviews.Content: Been coming to this Hotel for a long time. Rates are Great. The Staff is Excellent, Treasea, Kristy, Alan, Ed, Willi Mae, Massilin are all the best to make you feel at home. Never seen any varmites in my room. Does need a remodel. Haven't had one since I've been coming here. All in all a good clean safe place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression:”
Reviews.Author: wendydrake2005
Reviews.Content: I experience the most wonderful person at the front end counter while staying at the Red Roof Inn East: Memphis (Teresa) she has the smile and personality you will never forget. I would like to thank the Management for having her being the first person guest sees. She will be the reason guest will return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: LittleRock25
Reviews.Content: The room had bed bugs. What more can I say? Guess you get what you pay for. The area seemed like a nice area. Please don't make the costly mistake that I made. It's a memory I'd like to erase.

Reviews.Title: “good price and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: panther233
Reviews.Content: Booked the room online at www,redroofinn.com and got a great price. Room was average, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a caring manager”
Reviews.Author: mpowell
Reviews.Content: For the price, about $50 for a King downstairs..it's o.k. I would trade the fridge/micro for a coffee pot and shampoo. Previous cleanliness issues remain unaddressed. Carpet is shot & a good spring cleaning is called for. I also would prefer to see security out and about rather than hanging out in the lobby chatting.

Reviews.Title: “Worn out!”
Reviews.Author: Loader2001
Reviews.Content: Has to be the worse Red Roof I have stayed in. Best way to describe it was simply worn out and in need of renovation. Seeing a notice by the Memphis PD condeming a room for a Meth Lab didn't help either.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: PapaBart
Reviews.Content: Room was surface clean, but around the edges were terrible. Carpet old and buckled up. Chair had tear in seat. It gave me the creeps. Loud. Police were there. Nice location, but lots of other hotels within walking distance. Staff at desk were very nice. Hot shower.

Reviews.Title: “This Red Roof was very convenient and comfortable. I loved their pet-friendly attitude!”
Reviews.Author: runninglady123
Reviews.Content: I looked a very long time to find a hotel that was in a good location and accepted pets without an extra charge and without a weight limit. I was very happy when we arrived and they had our room and paperwork ready. We checked in quickly without any hassles. Also, it was very nice of Red Roof to honor teachers by giving a discount rate. The room was large, clean, quiet and comfortable. The bathroom was clean. The location of the hotel was easy to find off of the highway. My husband walked to the Cracker Barrel next door to bring back dinner while I stayed with our dog. I was also happy with the cheerful person who checked us in after our long drive!

Reviews.Title: “Please with my stay”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy551
Reviews.Content: I made reservations ahead of time and was very pleased with the whole experience. We checked in late, still had the reservation. The room was very clean and very modern. It was also very close to restaurants. We went to the Waffle House, which was right next door. I would stay here again, when travelling through Memphis, TN.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly, Stained, Horrible room and felt unsafe”
Reviews.Author: knuts74
Reviews.Content: After 14 hours of driving my husband and I decided to take a break and chose this hotel over many others in the area. It was a very reasonable price (especially since we were just stopping for some sleep). The lady at the night desk was very nice and helpful but the room was less than desirable. The carpet had stains and was dirty near the baseboards (all around the room). The easy chair arms were also worn/soiled. A loud group of mid teens was walking back and forth pass our door and into the parking lot. They were loud and with no concern of others. This went on for about a hour. Upon getting into the bed, it smelled of stale cigarettes (it was a no smoking room). I was ready to leave and find a better place but my husband was too tired to deal with it so we stayed. The next morning the gentleman that checked me out was nice/courteous but when I spoke of my concern of the horrible smelling bed his only remark was that sometimes people smoke in the no smoking rooms. I went in knowing we didn't pay much for the room but at least expected a clean room where I would feel safe for the night for a few hours sleep. What happened instead was I spent $55 to spend the night in a smelly room with loud people outside. I think we would have been better off just sleeping in our clean rental car at a rest stop.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic budget hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Walby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Red Roof in late March for 3 nights. The room was cleaned each and every day, with no complaints to be made on any of the days. We had a room w/ a king size bed, and working desk. The hotel had free wi-fi, which my wife took advantage of almost every day of our stay, and never had an issue with it. We paid a little under $50 a night. The location is decent. We went to a few different areas of Memphis, ( to be specific, we went to the memphis zoo, Beale St., Graceland, and the casinos in MS. during our 3 day stay) and this hotel was pretty convenient for all of our destinations. We stayed on the east side of Memphis due to the fact that we went to Nashville after our stay in Memphis and this location was convenient to our plans. Easy on and off the interstate. Their are plenty of places to eat nearby, from Ruby Tuesdays, and Shoneys, to fast food like Taco Bell, Churches Chicken, etc; all within a mile or two. We found a bar nearby called Good TIme Charlies, which was a fun place to hang and have a couple beers as well.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but I'd go elsewhere next time.”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an old style Red Roof and has not been renovated up to the new standard, but the price was also not up to the level of the newer style Red Roofs. So, in overview it was an OK stay, and a safe one, although I felt like it wasn't an area to wander around at night (probably the iron fence around the parking lot at the Drury Inn next door), and I felt obligated to check my vehicle more than once. The parking is well lit.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Red Roof standards”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyboyTennessee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this inn a dozen or more times over the past few years. It is shocking how deteriorated and shabby the property has become. Other than daily, semi-adequate supercial cleaning, the condition of each room is deplorable and the Red Roof chain should either renovate or remove it from its assets. Just disgusting and not worth recommending to anyone regardless of the price.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: ashleynichole
Reviews.Content: I would like to know how someone was charged $40 a night. For me and my 4 yr old a SINGLE room was $170 for 2 nights. The cups on the bathroom sink had some type of brown slime on them it looked like someone had vomited on the carpet in the corner of the room and no one ever cleaned it up. Something was spilled all over the nightstand and never cleaned. My daughter left her shirt in the bathroom floor and we left it there because when I picked it up a roach ran out. NASTY WILL NEVER STAY AT A RED ROOF INN AGAIN please save your money it is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rooms, Run Down”
Reviews.Author: travelmike_9
Reviews.Content: I stay at Red Roofs Inn sometimes on business trips. Generally, they have been a good value with just a clean, basic room. The Red Roof Inn, East Memphis is one of the worst motels I've ever stayed at. Everyone's room was dirty. The carpet was stained, dirty, and needed a better vacuuming. The walls were dirty and stained. The lamp shades were stained and dusty. The chairs were stained and very old. The bed was old with threadbare linens and blanket. Even the TV worked poorly. The only reason we stayed at the place was we arrived very late after a long day of travel, otherwise we would have left. I don't recommend this motel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money, would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: banjo60
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night while going to Graceland. For the money we paid, around $49 a night this wasn't a bad deal. While checking in the staff seemed to not care that I had to wait while she went thru the reservations looking for somebody else's while I was standing there (there was nobody else even there, this could've been done later). The room was clean, the cover on the bed was the ugliest thing you'll ever see. The stay was good, housekeeping woke us up bright and early at 7am wanting to clean the room, we advised them we were checking out and to come back later. The motel wasn't really near Graceland, but we stayed here for the price. What you see is what you get here. It was located near a Walgreen's which we did take advantage of, there was also a McDonald's a stone's throw away. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but wouldnt recommend..”
Reviews.Author: jadesboutique
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online even after reading these reviews. I liked that it was pet friendly with no extra fee's. It seemed fairly safe, except late at night it was very noisy outside our room I found myself looking out the window a lot at my car to make sure it was ok. lol The bathroom was very clean. The carpets had a few stains on them and felt/looked dirty. The bed was comfortable. Don't go to the mcdonalds by there either..its horrible - the menu isnt even by the speaker...how are you supposed to order like that? lol I wouldnt recommend this hotel, on my way back to NC from CA I will look for a different hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for fraudulent credit card charges. . .”
Reviews.Author: Denali_dragon
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at this Red Roof in February and did not have any major problems. However, when I called to check the availability of rooms for a date in March, an employee took it upon themselves to access my credit card information from a previous stay--you only have to stay once to be considered a regular guest and your credit card information "saved," a policy I wasn't aware of--and made a reservation for me, even though I did not authorize it. When I did not appear on that date--again, I was only checking availability, not making a reservation--I was charged for the night. I have spent a great deal of time in the past two months trying to have this charge removed and have gotten a different response from each local and/or corporate employee I speak to. I was even told that it was "assumed" that I was making a reservation when I simply gave my name, even though I did not give them my credit card number nor authorize them to use the one on file. Do not stay at this hotel unless you are ready to be charged for a room you did not reserve and did not stay in. I will never stay at another Red Roof Inn, no matter where it's located.

Reviews.Title: “the stay please read before you pay”
Reviews.Author: angeloforange
Reviews.Content: In every hotel you have good and bad. My family stayed in this hotel one night in memphis tenn. We left the next day here is my review. I am typeing just before we leave. We got there and check in was easy. The water pressure in the showers was alright. the coffee was good. Two of the three rooms where alright. The Television didnt have many channels. There was much noise going on from outside. We didnt have enough towels or shampoo. The Pillows where extremely flat and uncofortable as where the beds. When we called for some more stuff we had to go and get it. The third room we had was NASTY! there were stains on the floor the walls ect. there werent any shades on ANY of the lights. When my niece and my cousins friends little girl crawled on the floor then picked up there was black stuff ALL on the front of their legs. the bottom of your feet/ socks turned black also. cheap prices dont always mean that there are bad rooms. In our case it was a 1 out of 3 rooms. I suggest that you pay the extra 20 or so bucks and get a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs a lot of improvement”
Reviews.Author: Arunkumarv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red roof Inn Memphis east for 3 days. Although I checked in a little late due to my arrival at the airport, checking in was no problem. Well, the usual things like lights, bath accessories, heaters/cooler was fine. It was located conveniently from the Memphis airport on the I40. But apart from this, the bathroom was kind of dinghy, the towels were not that good, the TV remote didn't work and definitely for the price paid, the room (2 king Bed) was kind of small. And, I did not even book it at the last minute. I booked it at least 3 weeks before. So, it definitely needs a lot of improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Overall”
Reviews.Author: SOKYWOMAN
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for two nights during a weekend getaway to Memphis. We were only about a 15-20 min. drive down I-40 to downtown Memphis and were within easy walking distance to several restaurants, other hotels, stores, etc. (We walked to the Cracker Barrel next door for both breakfast and dinner). Felt very safe here and the place seemed very quiet despite the fact that they were completely booked. Only complaints were the rude housekeeping staff we had to encounter. Will stay here again if not at this hotel then at least at this exit (12).

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option...”
Reviews.Author: ju123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Roof Inn for 2 nights during a 7 month round the world trip. It was mainly down to the reviews on this site we decided to book and in the end we were pleased with the hotel. It is very basic but we found it reasonably clean and at a price of $40 a night could find no complaints. Staff were friendly and helped out with directions etc. Location was about 20mins drive from downtown Memphis, similar to Graceland. There is a long strip of restaurants and fast food outlets about 2 mins drive away, we found the Ruby Tuesday's to be very good, also a bit further up the road is an Applebees. For breakfast we opted for Cracker Barrel next door which was nice and inexpensive. Free coffee in the reception area is a nice touch. All in all, a good clean budget hotel. Enough said really....:)

Reviews.Title: “Good price, but dirty & scary!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcouple05
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at other Red Roof Inns in the past and always been pleased, however this one left us wanting to check out as soon as we checked in! The room itself was dirty, the walls were falling apart as was the ceiling. The sheets were paper thin, and had many holes and stains. There was trash under and behind the bed, and you just felt gross being in the room the whole time. If you want a cheap place to go, then it's ok. But if you value your health, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and Dandy”
Reviews.Author: umslgrad
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet and friendly desk staff. What else could you ask for $41 a night?

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Place to Spend the Night”
Reviews.Author: mwhite96
Reviews.Content: I stayed an evening here on my way home from a vacation on the other side of the country. This hotel is the hotel that time forgot! I felt like I had stepped back into the 1980's upon entering my room. It's not in the nicest part of town, but I am happy to report that nothing happened. (But I did take all of the valuables out of my car and bring them into the room before retiring for the night!) My room wasn't completely clean - the previous occupant's trash was sitting in a trashcan on the counter in the room. There were a few stains on the blanket on the bed, but it looked like bleach... which is way better than it could be! However, I did get a good night sleep. The bed was very comfortable and I had no issues whatsoever getting to bed. The shower, while dated, worked great and felt really good after a long day of driving. All in all, given the price of the hotel, I'm pleased with my stay. The lack of services would make me hesitate staying more than one night, but for a cheap place to crash while driving, this place will do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Red Roof Inn, Exit 12 / Sycamore View (I-40)”
Reviews.Author: UgaDawg71
Reviews.Content: If you want absolute budget then this is almost it. $38 gets you a simple room with a tv and not much else. No internet at all and I did notice that there were some apparent cleaning issues such as bottles and wrappers being stuffed in various spots behind the furniture. My room had wires hanging out behind the desk where the cable hooks up to the tv...electrical hazard for sure. There were some shady characters there but I never felt insecure. The place was actually full so I guess people will put up with minor inconveniences. The girl at the desk was great and had a good attitude.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: bootsie2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night, left for one night to stay in a nearby town, returned to this hotel for another 2 nights. Both rooms were Kings, first room was cleaner (floors) but both were ok. The bed takes up most of the space, small table and 2 chairs were in the way and we moved them to make a walkway around the bed. Adequate for our needs, Red Roof is pet-friendly and we have stayed at several. Convenient to I-40, family restaurants within walking distance, nice landscaping, staff is friendly and helpful, GREAT coffee machine for your morning coffee, needed a clock/radio in room and they replaced it immediately. We paid $42.49 online rate and felt it was a good value. Maintanance says they're due for a renovation within the year. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chemical_girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our road trip, one the first night we'd booked 2 rooms but couldn't get there in time due to car trouble and was no hassle changing the booking on the day. Location is fairly easy to find and you can walk to places to eat if you're a bit tired, although obviously not great places to eat. Room was clean and a good size. Didn't seem noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Clean, Cheap”
Reviews.Author: professor_computers
Reviews.Content: This location is easy to find and always a great deal for the money. I paid $43 for a weekend night....nice people, great security, clean overall. Would stay here again and again!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “awesome service”
Reviews.Author: hackjenn
Reviews.Content: For what it is, it is great, our son was in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit at the women's hospital, by baptist east, it was maybe a 5-10 min drive to the hospital which was great for us, I CANNOT SAY ENOUGH GOOD ABOUT THE STAFF, the staff was so compassionate to our needs, and always made sure that we were comfortable, and even gave us discounts and free rooms, because we basicly lived there every weekend for 2 months, and a night or 2 during the week for 2 months, I cannot be any more pleased with the staff of the red roof

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even though the desk took a night off from our 3 nights (I showed them some bedbugs), it still wasn't worth the price (room 226). The sheets were not changed for our first night; I requested a change for the next day, and then the third day the cleaning crew didn't show. The mattresses had tiny (old) blood stains from the bedbugs. Really horrible.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Roof Inn Memphis East
HotelInfo.Address: 6055 Shelby Oaks Drive, I-40 at Sycamore View Boulevard, Exit #12, Memphis, TN 38134
